TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GlyphTypeface extends System.Object implements class System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize

Docs.summary: Specifies a physical font face that corresponds to a font file on the disk.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> object is a low level text object that corresponds to a single face of a font family as represented by an OpenType font file, or serialized as a block of memory in a document. The correct <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> to use for a run of characters in a given logical font is normally determined by the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] font system and recorded in the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphRun> objects generated by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.FormattedText> object and line formatting text [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_api#plural](~/includes/tla2sharptla-apisharpplural-md.md)].
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> provides properties and methods for:
- Obtaining font face common metrics, such as the ratio of ascent and descent to em size.
- Obtaining metrics, outlines, and bitmaps for individual glyphs.
- Serialization in a document.
The following list describes the type of application scenarios that illustrate the value of using the low-level control that the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> object provides.
- A fixed format document generator may use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> to obtain a binary image of the font for embedding in a document container
- A printer driver may use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> to obtain font glyph outlines or bitmaps, or the entire font image for sending to the printer.
- A <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> viewer application may use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> to obtain metric and bitmap information.
Each glyph defines metrics that specify how it aligns with other <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Glyphs>. The following graphic defines metric values for glyph characters.
![Diagraph of glyph measurements](~/add/media/glyph-example.png "Diagraph of glyph measurements") Metric values of glyph characters

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor creates a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> object from an OpenType font face specified by `typefaceSource`. The constructed <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> object does not use style simulations.
## Examples The following example shows how to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> class by specifying a font file location.
[!code-csharp[GlyphTypefaceSnippets#GlyphTypefaceSnippet1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/GlyphTypefaceSnippets/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#glyphtypefacesnippet1)] [!code-vb[GlyphTypefaceSnippets#GlyphTypefaceSnippet1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/GlyphTypefaceSnippets/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#glyphtypefacesnippet1)]

Docs.param: The [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uri](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uri-md.md)] that specifies the location of the font file.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified font file location and value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor creates a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> object from an OpenType font face specified by `typefaceSource` and `styleSimulations`.

Docs.summary: Gets the advance heights for the glyphs represented by the object.
Docs.value: An object that contains key-value pairs that represents advance height information for the glyphs. The key is a that identifies the glyph index. The value is a that represents the advance height.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.AdvanceHeights%2A> property is used for calculating vertical layout.
## Examples The following example shows how to return the collection of advance heights from the glyphs in the font.
[!code-csharp[GlyphTypefaceSnippets#GlyphTypefaceSnippet2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/GlyphTypefaceSnippets/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#glyphtypefacesnippet2)] [!code-vb[GlyphTypefaceSnippets#GlyphTypefaceSnippet2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/GlyphTypefaceSnippets/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#glyphtypefacesnippet2)]

Docs.value: An object that contains key/value pairs that represents advance width information for the glyphs. The key is a that identifies the glyph index. The value is a that represents the advance width.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.AdvanceHeights%2A> property is used for calculating horizontal layout.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Baseline As Double
public: property double Baseline { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the baseline value for the .
Docs.value: A value of type that represents the baseline.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The baseline value represents the distance from cell top to English baseline relative to em size.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property BottomSideBearings As IDictionary(Of UShort, Double)
public: property System::Collections::Generic::IDictionary<System::UInt16, double> ^ BottomSideBearings { System::Collections::Generic::IDictionary<System::UInt16, double> ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the distance from bottom edge of the black box to the bottom end of the advance vector for the glyphs represented by the object.
Docs.value: An object that contains key/value pairs that represent distance information. The key is a that identifies the glyph. The value is a that represents the distance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.BottomSideBearings%2A> value is positive when the bottom edge of the black box is within the alignment rectangle defined by the advance width and font cell height. The font cell height is a horizontal dimension in vertical layout.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.BottomSideBearings%2A> value is negative when the bottom edge of the black box overhangs the alignment rectangle.

public: property double CapsHeight { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the distance from the baseline to the top of an English capital, relative to em size, for the object.
Docs.value: A that indicates the distance from the baseline to the top of an English capital letter, expressed as a fraction of the font em size.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the font file does not provide a name for the specified language, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.FaceNames%2A> property returns the face name in English. The face name may identify weight, style, and/or stretch information.

Docs.summary: Gets the distance from the leading end of the advance vector to the left edge of the black box for the glyphs represented by the object.
Docs.value: An object that contains key/value pairs that represent distance information for the glyphs. The key is a that identifies the glyph index. The value is a that represents the distance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.LeftSideBearings%2A> value is positive when the left edge of the black box is within the alignment rectangle defined by the advance width and font cell height.
The <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.LeftSideBearings%2A> value is negative when the left edge of the black box overhangs the alignment rectangle.

Docs.value: An object that contains key/value pairs that represent version string information. The key is a object that identifies the culture. The value is a string that represents the version.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Version strings vary significantly in format. To obtain the version as a numeric value, use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.Version%2A>—do not attempt to parse the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.VersionStrings%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Win32FaceNames As IDictionary(Of CultureInfo, String)

public: property System::Collections::Generic::IDictionary<System::Globalization::CultureInfo ^, System::String ^> ^ Win32FaceNames { System::Collections::Generic::IDictionary<System::Globalization::CultureInfo ^, System::String ^> ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the Win32 face name for the font represented by the object.
Docs.value: An object that contains key/value pairs that represent Win32 face name information. The key is a object that identifies the culture. The value is a string that represents the Win32 face name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the font does not provide a name for the specified language, it returns the face name in English. The Win32 face name may identify weights (other than regular or bold), and/or style, but may not identify stretch or other weights.

public: property System::Collections::Generic::IDictionary<System::Globalization::CultureInfo ^, System::String ^> ^ Win32FamilyNames { System::Collections::Generic::IDictionary<System::Globalization::CultureInfo ^, System::String ^> ^ get(); };

Docs.value: An object that contains key/value pairs that represent Win32 family name information. The key is a object that identifies the culture. The value is a string that represents the Win32 family name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the font does not provide a family name for the specified language, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface.Win32FamilyNames%2A> property returns the family name in English. The Win32 family name excludes regular or bold weights and style, but it includes other weights and stretch.
